pullRequest.body:
Define a `Kernel α γ` and a `Kernel β γ` from a `Kernel (α × β) γ` by taking the comap of `fun a ↦ (a, b)` and `fun b ↦ (a, b)` respectively.

- Add definitions of `Kernel.fst'` and `Kernel.snd'`.
- Add some API lemmas: `fst'_apply`, `fst'_zero`, `comap_fst'`, `fst'_prodMkLeft`, `fst'_prodMkRight` and the equivalent lemmas for `snd'`.
- Add instances for `IsMarkovKernel`, `IsFiniteKernel`, `IsSFiniteKernel` and `NeZero`.
- Add `fst'_swapRight` and `snd'_swapRight`.
- Add `compProd_apply_eq_compProd_snd'`.

---

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message

- ...

### PR summary [30ec8f8516](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15466/commits/30ec8f8516d0f248e2b7fe54bed3c7d38a49f9fb)

#### Import changes for modified files

<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ _root_.ProbabilityTheory.Kernel.compProd_apply_eq_compProd_domSnd`
`+ comap_domFst`
`+ comap_domSnd`
`+ domFst`
`+ domFst_apply`
`+ domFst_prodMkLeft`
`+ domFst_prodMkRight`
`+ domFst_swapRight`
`+ domFst_zero`
`+ domSnd`
`+ domSnd_apply`
`+ domSnd_prodMkLeft`
`+ domSnd_prodMkRight`
`+ domSnd_swapRight`
`+ domSnd_zero`
`+ instance (priority := 100) {κ : Kernel (α × β) γ} [∀ b, IsMarkovKernel (domFst κ b)] :`
`+ instance (priority := 100) {κ : Kernel (α × β) γ} [∀ b, IsMarkovKernel (domSnd κ b)] :`
`+ instance (κ : Kernel (α × β) γ) (a : α) (b : β) [NeZero (κ (a, b))] : NeZero ((domFst κ b) a) := by`
`+ instance (κ : Kernel (α × β) γ) (a : α) (b : β) [NeZero (κ (a, b))] : NeZero ((domSnd κ a) b) := by`
`+ instance (κ : Kernel (α × β) γ) (a : α) [IsFiniteKernel κ] : IsFiniteKernel (domSnd κ a) := by`
`+ instance (κ : Kernel (α × β) γ) (a : α) [IsMarkovKernel κ] : IsMarkovKernel (domSnd κ a) := by`
`+ instance (κ : Kernel (α × β) γ) (a : α) [IsSFiniteKernel κ] : IsSFiniteKernel (domSnd κ a) := by`
`+ instance (κ : Kernel (α × β) γ) (b : β) [IsFiniteKernel κ] : IsFiniteKernel (domFst κ b) := by`
`+ instance (κ : Kernel (α × β) γ) (b : β) [IsMarkovKernel κ] : IsMarkovKernel (domFst κ b) := by`
`+ instance (κ : Kernel (α × β) γ) (b : β) [IsSFiniteKernel κ] : IsSFiniteKernel (domFst κ b) := by`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>
The names are `Kernel.fst'` and `Kernel.snd'`, since `Kernel.fst` and `Kernel.snd` are already taken for the case where the codomain is a product space. Suggestions for a better name are welcome.

About names: there are [Function.Embedding.sectl](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Logic/Embedding/Basic.html#Function.Embedding.sectl) and [MonoidHom.inl](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Group/Prod.html#MonoidHom.inl). Probably, the former is closer to this case. Also, please ask on Zulip for other suggestions.

Could you rename that to
```suggestion
noncomputable def domFst (κ : Kernel (α × β) γ) (b : β) : Kernel α γ :=
```
? Then `Kernel.fst` can be renamed to `Kernel.codFst`

Thank you for the suggestion!
Among the proposed names this is the one I prefer, so for now I am going to use it.

Regarding [`Kernel.fst`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Probability/Kernel/Composition.html#ProbabilityTheory.Kernel.fst), I think the current name is fitting, since it is defined using [`Prod.fst`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Init/Prelude.html#Prod.fst) and pointwise it is equal to the first marginal of the measure [Measure.fst](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/MeasureTheory/Measure/Prod.html#MeasureTheory.Measure.fst), as can be seen from the following equality:

```
example {α β γ : Type*} [MeasurableSpace α] [MeasurableSpace β] [MeasurableSpace γ] 
    (κ : Kernel α (β × γ)) (a : α) : κ.fst a = (κ a).fst := rfl
```

Yes, so the situation here is that `Kernel` is functorial in both its arguments, contravariantly in the first and covariantly in the second. This means that `Prod.fst : α × β → α` gives rise to two natural maps that could "fittingly" be called `Kernel.fst`:
* `Kernel α γ → Kernel (α × β) γ`, which you are introducing here
* `Kernel γ (α × β) → Kernel γ α`, which is the existing `Kernel.fst`

What I am suggesting is to prefix `dom` and `cod` to disambiguate which side you are doing the functoriality on

... and now I realise that you are not introducing the map `Kernel α γ → Kernel (α × β) γ` but rather `β → Kernel (α × β) γ → Kernel α γ` which is functoriality in the first argument from the map `Prod.sectL b : α → α × β`.

Following my naming convention suggestion, this should be called `domSectL`.

I see, this is similar to a previous suggestion to use `sectl`; it still feels a bit obscure as a name to me, but since this definition is not really linked to `Prod.fst` I guess that it really makes no sense for `fst` to appear in the name, so `sectl` will do.

I have doubts about 2 details:
- Is the `dom` part actually useful? With a quick search into the library I didn't find any occurrence of this convention and I'm not sure whether we will ever need `codSecL`.
- Should `L` at the end be capitalized (`sectL` vs `sectl`)? In Mathlib it seems to always appear non capitalized (e.g. [`Prod.sectl`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/CategoryTheory/Products/Basic.html#CategoryTheory.Prod.sectl)).

* I don't know whether we will ever need `codSectL`, no. Feel free to keep the `dom` out of the name for now
* I personally find `sectl` and `sectr` to be quite obscure names, while `sectL` and `sectR` are much clearer in their intent. I think it's okay to use `sectl` for now, but I would prefer `sectL`, and even better would be to first rename all the `sectl` to `sectL`

pullRequest.title: feat (Probability.Kernel): Add definitions and API for `Kernel.fst'` and `snd'`
